title: Goldman Sachs to defend Ardent as alarm bells ring
text:
Ardent Leisure has Goldman Sachs' investment bankers poring over the company's share register, seeking to identify who was willing to pay a 20 per cent premium for its shares.

It is understood Ardent has retained Goldman Sachs as defence adviser, after the Wall Street giant knocked off a handful of rivals to retain the title earlier this year.

Ardent Leisure's board, chaired by Gary Weiss, is advised by Goldman Sachs. Christopher Pearce

It's fair to say the alarm bells were ringing at Ardent on Tuesday, after a buyer snapped up a 4 per cent stake in the company at $1.20 a share – a 20 per cent premium on the then-traded price.

The shares closed at $1.21 as fast money funds started scratching around the story.

While it is not known who bought the shares, it will be Goldman Sachs' job to uncover the identity in coming days.
description: Ardent Leisure has Goldman Sachs looking for who was willing to pay a 20 per cent premium for its shares.
